website_summaries.verdict: The Under Armour Jet Mid is considered an everyday shoe for any activity, but the shoe model really belongs to the basketball category. It is a performer at a good price. It may not have the most up-to-date technology but the Jet Mid is a pair that can deliver as advertised.If wearers opt to use the latest technology Under Armour has to offer, Stephen Curry has recently released his sixth Curry signature shoe. For those who don’t like to pay premium for signature shoes, the UA HOVR Havoc is a great alternative.
pros: A large number of Under Armour Jet Mid owners love wearing the shoe because of its nice colors
A good number of buyers are happy with the price of the Under Armour Jet Mid
Several wearers appreciate that these UA basketball shoes do not need much time to break in
A lot of wearers agree that the shoe model is stylish because of its clean and simple look
The EVA foam used on these Under Armour basketball shoes must have worked because plenty of users say the shoe is comfortable and lightweight
cons: Some have reported that the material on the upper starts to rip after just a few uses
A small number of wearers complain that the inner parts of these Under Armour basketball shoes cause the skin on their Achilles heel to have blisters

customer_reviews.title: Reminded me of $10 Kmart Shoes
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thinking the Under Armour brand would be at least a decent quality. This shoe is lightweight, because it has no substance. The material is thin and cheap. There is an inside pad, but it is flat with no arch support. The outside/anterior ball portion of the shoe is built up, presumably to help prevent "rollower" ankle ankle sprains. As the anterior sole is built up and the posterior insole is flat. The gemoetry of this shoe creates major ankle pronation issues Definately not for anyone with flat or ankle problems. :(
customer_reviews.author: Carguy Accountant

customer_reviews.title: Very narrow
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear a 10 wide. I figured a 10.5 would fill the bill. Not so, way too narrow. Returning and trying for an 11. I do like the looks of the shoe. Hope the 11 does the trick.
customer_reviews.author: George S

customer_reviews.title: Almost Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I’m a basketball shoes buyer for years now , about 22 years of trying and using . This UA mid jet is one of the best ever I bought . Fits exactly, flexy and light . The mesh upper construction is just fine . The mesh synthetic material is what every sport shoe should be made from . Thanks UA. The disappointment came from the tongue low thickness cushion and somehow not wide enough like other brands .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The tongue is not cut right
customer_reviews.text: I kept this pair of shoes but the tongue of the shoe does not hide under the laces on either side, and my foot is a regular medium width foot, also at the top the tongue sticks outward instead of flat against the leg. My immediate idea was that these were cheap shoes with an Under Armor logo stuck on it. I have another pair of Under Armor high tops I love, but these I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Spock

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable and sized too small
customer_reviews.text: Disappointment with these shoes. The whole line of this model doesn't fit true to size, I had to keep returning and reordering a half size up. Once I finally found a size that fits, I determined that the shoe itself is just not comfortable, at least for my foot. The outer edge of the shoe seemed to squeeze my foot. I'm a woman with narrow feet, I can't imagine a man wearing these comfortably. I returned all three pairs, I'm going back to Nike.
customer_reviews.author: coolnerd31

customer_reviews.title: poor circulation, so was a little hesitant to buy ...
customer_reviews.text: Prefect fit , I hav neuropathy pain in both feet and they get swelling from a arotic bifemeral bypass 8 years ago , poor circulation, so was a little hesitant to buy a size 12.5 online cause I need the extra width . Trust me I will buy again from UA. Great job guys
customer_reviews.author: jim hackett

customer_reviews.title: Online challenges
customer_reviews.text: Although it's a nice and pretty inexpensive shoe, it's hard to determine the fit until you receive the item and put it on. Almost all of the UA shoes I've purchased in the past have a wide base. This particular one unfortunately is very narrow and is uncomfortable for someone like myself who has wide feet. I would still recommend UA as a brand to purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Kobashigawa

customer_reviews.title: These are great shoes but I wasn't able to give a 5 ...
customer_reviews.text: These are great shoes but I wasn't able to give a 5 star rating because the first pair I received tore at the laces immediately upon wearing. This was replaced and the second pair has been flawless, must have been a defect in the material on the first pair.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Dupont

customer_reviews.title: Big tongue no support.
customer_reviews.text: Do not confuse this with Under Armor high performance basketball sneakers. The are a notch or two below. When I opened the box I instantly noticed exaggerated tongue. It’s large and floppy which of course makes an awkward fit when you’re tying your laces tight. I emphasize tying the laces tight because there’s a major lack of ankle support for a high top sneaker. One off balance landing and you’re sure to sprain your ankles or worse. Looks similar to other UA kicks but misses the mark.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Mendes

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for those with big feet
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe! Comfortable and does it's job. It's hard to find shoes in larger sizes (size 15 and 16) that look good. These fit as expected and are true to size. I do have wide feet and these had room to accommodate that
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: Fit true to size for Under Armour shoes
customer_reviews.text: My 13 year old son picked these out for his game shoes this year. These are true to size for Under Armour shoes (meaning, UA runs a full size larger than Nike). His everyday tennis shoes are Nikes size 12.5, and the 11.5 in these fit just right. He was thrilled with them.
customer_reviews.author: mhjh1006

customer_reviews.title: Half size small
customer_reviews.text: They are half size small, if you are size 10 buy them half size bigger. For basketball they are light and wide. I have bunion, bone spurs and plantar fasciitis and I can tell you they work just fine.
customer_reviews.author: eduardo morales

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, just not durable.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to use for work. I work in rehab, so I do a lot of walking with my patients. They feel great on the feet with more than adequate amount of cushion. However, after one month, I'm noticing the fabric on the tops of the shoes is wearing thin. Also, the bonding across the toes is starting to lift off.
customer_reviews.author: Optimistic Unicorn

customer_reviews.title: Dimple in the toe
customer_reviews.text: For some reason after wearing these shoes only a handful of times there is a dimple in the toe of the shoe that is permanent and just looks awful. Waste of $65 because I cannot wear these anymore. I would not recommend buying thi particular pair as there is no support in the toes and very easy to dimple.
customer_reviews.author: ContainerGardenGirl

customer_reviews.title: I got a used pair 😡
customer_reviews.text: Shoes came and had obviously been worn before. I plan to hoop in them so its not a huge deal to me really but it's still disappointing to get something that doesnt meet your expectations from the start

customer_reviews.title: Nice-looking shoe
customer_reviews.text: Nice-looking shoe! Very pleased with the order except the shoes fit a little small and also our narrow. Ordered a half size larger as per another reviewer comments and I think they will be ok. Have only wore them a couple times so far but I'm hoping the sides will stretch a little.

customer_reviews.text: Finally a shoe my teen likes in his size. Do u know how hard it is to be cool at 7’ tall when u are only 17 and wear a size 16 shoe... pretty tough! Everything is tough enough including finding shoes that are made for teen styles in extended styles that fit the budget.

I bought some Adidas shoes a week later and they are great. Fit like a glove and comfortable. I am sticking with Adidas.

product_meta.title: Under Armour Men's Jet Mid Basketball Shoe
product_meta.description: Synthetic textile upper for breathability & support. Enhanced cushioning around ankle collar for superior comfort. Ventilated mesh midfoot panel. Molded heel for locked-in support & fit. Die-cut EVA sockliner provides underfoot cushioning & support. Compression molded EVA midsole delivers a lightweight & responsive ride. Rubber outsole with unique traction pattern for lateral movements & maximum grip. Weight: 12.3 oz.
feature_bullets: Synthetic textile upper for breathability & support
Enhanced cushioning around ankle collar for superior comfort
Molded heel for locked in support & fit
Die cut EVA sockliner provides underfoot cushioning & support
